solution_line_template: After the first mission, the number of cats remaining on the island was {original_cats}-{first_relocation_amount} = <<{original_cats}-{first_relocation_amount}={cats_after_first_mission}>>{cats_after_first_mission}.

If half of the remaining cats on the island were relocated to a rescue center inland, the number of cats taken by the wildlife service on the second mission is {cats_after_first_mission}/{second_relocation_divisor} = <<{cats_after_first_mission}/{second_relocation_divisor}={cats_second_mission}>>{cats_second_mission} cats.
The number of cats remaining on the island is {cats_after_first_mission}-{cats_second_mission} = <<{cats_after_first_mission}-{cats_second_mission}={remaining_cats}>>{remaining_cats}
